intro: Conyza virens, commonly known as greenleaf fleabane, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, hairy stems and alternate leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in a composite head, which attracts various pollinators. Conyza virens is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
